description: From Middle French pacifier, from Latin pāx (“peace”) + faciō (“I do, make”). Cognate with pay and peacify.

verbs.description: pacify (third-person singular simple present pacifies, present participle pacifying, simple past and past participle pacified)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To bring peace to (a place or situation), by ending war, fighting, violence, anger or agitation.
